areaSection: Santa Pola is a vibrant coastal town in southern Costa Blanca, Alicante province, positioned strategically between the major tourism hubs of Benidorm and Torrevieja. This authentic Spanish town combines traditional Mediterranean charm with modern amenities, hosting a working fishing port that supplies fresh seafood to local restaurants daily. The climate is consistently warm with 300+ days of sunshine annually, creating ideal conditions for year-round outdoor living and tourism. Santa Pola's 12km of pristine coastline features multiple Blue Flag beaches, while the protected natural area of Isla de Santa Pola offers unique ecological interest. Unlike over-developed tourist zones, Santa Pola maintains genuine local character while offering excellent infrastructure—hospitals, international schools, shopping centers, and transport links are all easily accessible. The town's strategic location provides quick access to Alicante Airport (30 minutes) and major Costa Blanca attractions.

faqs.question: Czy obcokrajowcy mogą kupić nieruchomość w Hiszpanii?
faqs.answer: Yes. Foreign nationals have equal property purchase rights to Spanish citizens. No visa or residency requirement exists for property ownership. Legal process requires NIE (tax identification number) and completion through Spanish notary. Many UK and international buyers purchase without residing in Spain.

faqs.question: Jakie są koszty zakupu nieruchomości w Hiszpanii?
faqs.answer: Purchase costs typically total 8-10% of property price. Breakdown includes: notary fees (0.5-1%), property transfer tax (6-8% depending on region), property registry (0.1%), and legal fees (1-2%). Additional ongoing costs include annual property tax (IBI) of 0.4-1.1% of cadastral value and community fees if applicable.

faqs.question: Czy mogę uzyskać kredyt hipoteczny w Hiszpanii jako obcokrajowiec?
faqs.answer: Yes. Spanish banks offer mortgages to foreign buyers, typically requiring 30% deposit minimum and full documentation. NIE number is essential. Interest rates competitive with UK mortgages. Many international buyers combine Spanish mortgages with UK equity release for tax-efficient financing.

faqs.question: Jakie są koszty życia na Costa Blanca?
faqs.answer: Monthly living costs for one person average €800-1,200 including rent, food, utilities, and transport. Couples typically budget €1,200-1,800 monthly. Retired couples with modest lifestyle manage on €1,500-2,000 monthly. Costs significantly lower than UK major cities, particularly accommodation and dining.

faqs.question: What are typical rental rates for apartments in Santa Pola?
faqs.answer: Holiday let rates for 3-bedroom apartments average €800/week during peak season (June-September), reducing to €500-600/week in shoulder seasons. Winter weekly rates typically €400-500. Well-managed properties achieve 70-80% annual occupancy, generating €35,000-45,000 annual gross income depending on positioning and amenities.

faqs.question: Jak daleko jest Costa Blanca od Polski?
faqs.answer: Flight distance approximately 1,200 miles; journey time 2.5-3 hours direct from UK airports. Alicante Airport serves 30+ UK destinations with budget airlines offering competitive fares (€20-50 each way). Many UK residents maintain Costa Blanca properties as weekend escapes or longer-term bases.

faqs.question: Jaka jest pogoda na Costa Blanca?
faqs.answer: Costa Blanca enjoys 300+ annual sunshine hours with average temperatures 17°C winter and 28°C summer. Rain averages 30 rainy days yearly, concentrated November-February. Mediterranean climate creates ideal beach and outdoor activity conditions. Summer heat (July-August) occasionally reaches 35°C, moderated by sea breezes.

faqs.question: What are property taxes in Spain?
faqs.answer: Annual property tax (IBI) ranges 0.4-1.1% of cadastral value, typically €300-600 for Costa Blanca apartments. Rental income tax applies at standard personal rates (19-45%) on net rental profit after expenses. Capital gains tax (19%) applies on appreciation when selling, with 3-year exemption for primary residence.
